meanings.definition: A call used to attract attention or express surprise or joy.
meanings.sent1: The children's joyful hillo echoed through the playground.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud hillo from across the street.
meanings.sent3: The hillo of the excited puppy made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her hillo of surprise could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The hillo of the birds in the morning filled the air with happiness.

meanings.sent1: He would hillo loudly to get his friend's attention.
meanings.sent2: I always hillo when I reach the top of the hill.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to hillo back and forth for fun.
meanings.sent4: She would hillo across the valley to hear the echo.
meanings.sent5: The coach would hillo to gather the team for practice.

meanings.sent1: The cows grazed peacefully on the green hillo.
meanings.sent2: We climbed the hillo to get a better view of the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The hillo in the distance looked like a giant sleeping turtle.
meanings.sent4: The hillo was covered in wildflowers, creating a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The children rolled down the hillo, laughing all the way.
